intro: Navarretia congesta, commonly known as the clustered navarretia, is a flowering plant native to California and Baja California. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, white or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in coastal areas. Navarretia congesta is known for its dense clusters of flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral.
